me.sudofu.sanitycheck
[Groovy] Class SanityChecker

java.lang.Object
  me.sudofu.sanitycheck.SanityChecker

class SanityChecker

An exentsible utility for performing a variety of basic or advanced sanity checks on input, data, parameters, arguments, etc.

The SanityChecker provides a small number of basic sanity checks. For each check performed, its result of pass or failure is recorded in a SanityCheckReport.

While the use-cases for the SanityChecker itself may be somewhat limited, it gives a good platform for easy extension and incorperation into more complex derivates of itself.

Authors:
Aaron Brown

Field Detail

allowPassOnNull

protected boolean allowPassOnNull
Indicates whether or not the SanityChecker should allow null entities to pass sanity checks.

By default, the behavior of SanityChecker is to fail any check if the entity is null.

If provided, this behavior can be overridden per sanity check.

classification

protected java.lang.String classification
The classification of the entity (for context).

By default, the classification is entity.

Other examples:

  • field
  • variable
  • input
  • argument

entity

protected java.lang.Object entity
The entity to perform checks on.

The value of the entity.

name

protected java.lang.String name
The name of the entity (for error context).

For example, the name of a method parameter.

report

protected SanityCheckReport report
The SanityCheckReport.

 
Constructor Detail

SanityChecker

SanityChecker()
Constructs a SanityChecker with the intial behavior of disallowing null to pass sanity checks.

SanityChecker

SanityChecker(boolean allowPassOnNull)
Constructs a SanityChecker, specifying the allowance of null passing sanity cheks.

There are two distinct behaviors of a SanityChecker:

  1. Implicitly check for null, and disallow nulls to pass the sanity check.
  2. Implicitly check for null, and allow nulls to pass the sanity check.
If provided, this behavior can be overridden per sanity check.

 
Method Detail

allowPassOnNull

SanityChecker allowPassOnNull()
Allow null checks to be a valid pass-condition.

There are two distinct behaviors of a SanityChecker:

  1. Implicitly check for null, and disallow nulls to pass the sanity check.
  2. Implicitly check for null, and allow nulls to pass the sanity check.
If provided, this behavior can be overridden per sanity check.

check

SanityChecker check(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Object entity)
Declare a new entity to check.
throws:
IllegalArgumentException A valid name must be provided; cannot be empty, cannot be null.
Parameters:
name - The name of the entity being checked (for example, the name of the parameter).
entity - The value of the entity being checked.

check

SanityChecker check(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Object entity, java.lang.String classification)
Declare a new entity to check.
throws:
IllegalArgumentException A valid name must be provided; cannot be empty, cannot be null.
Parameters:
name - The name of the entity being checked (for example, the name of the parameter).
entity - The value of the entity being checked.
classification - The classification of the entity that is being checked (for example, parameter); entity by default.

checkYourselfBeforeYouWreckYourself

protected void checkYourselfBeforeYouWreckYourself()
Use before sanity checks to ensure that a check method was invoked.

Because if you don't, you'll go insane in the membrane.

throws:
IllegalStateException Thrown if it has been detected that neither check(String,Object) nor check(String,Object,String) has been invoked before the first sanity check.

classMatch

boolean classMatch(java.lang.Class clazz)
Run a sanity check to ensure the entity is or extends a specific Class.

Default behavior specified by allowPassOnNull

throws:
IllegalArgumentException clazz must be provided; cannot be null.
throws:
IllegalStateException An entity must be declared via a check() invokation before any sanity checks can be performed.
throws:
IllegalArgumentException clazz must be provided; cannot be null.
Parameters:
clazz - The Class to test for.
Returns:
true if the test passes, false otherwise.

classMatch

boolean classMatch(java.lang.Class clazz, boolean allowPassOnNull)
Run a sanity check to ensure the entity is or extends a specific Class.
throws:
IllegalArgumentException clazz must be provided; cannot be null.
throws:
IllegalStateException An entity must be declared via a check() invokation before any sanity checks can be performed.
throws:
IllegalArgumentException clazz must be provided; cannot be null.
Parameters:
allowPassOnNull - Explicitly declare or override the behavior of allowPassOnNull
clazz - The Class to test for.
Returns:
true if the test passes, false otherwise.

countFailures

int countFailures()
Count the number of sanity check failures.

In practice, this number is unpredictable as some sanity checks may have implicit sanity checks. For example, most sanity checks will perform a check to ensure the entity is not null before performing the actual check, which would mean for that one check, 2 would be the total count (if both failed).

Returns:
The number of failed sanity check entries; 0 (zero) otherwise.

countPasses

int countPasses()
Count the number of sanity check passes.

In practice, this number is unpredictable as some sanity checks may have implicit sanity checks. For example, most sanity checks will perform a check to ensure the entity is not null before performing the actual check, which would mean for that one check, 2 would be the total count (if both passed).

Returns:
The number of passed sanity check entries; 0 (zero) otherwise.

countResults

int countResults()
Count the number of results recorded.

Note that this is an unpredictable number, as many sanity checks run implicit checks such isNotNull.

Returns:
The number of results recorded, or 0 (zero) if no checks have been run.

disallowPassOnNull

SanityChecker disallowPassOnNull()
Disallow null checks to be a valid pass-condition.

There are two distinct behaviors of a SanityChecker:

  1. Implicitly check for null, and disallow nulls to pass the sanity check.
  2. Implicitly check for null, and allow nulls to pass the sanity check.
If provided, this behavior can be overridden per sanity check.

fail

protected void fail(java.lang.String check, java.lang.String checkDescription)
Use when a sanity check has failed.
Parameters:
check - The check that was performed (for example, isNotNull).
checkDesscription - A succinct description of the check, or its intended purpose (for example, Must not be null).

getFailures

java.util.List getFailures()
Retrieve the entries for sanity checks that have failed.

Key Description
result Whether or not the check passed or failed.
name The name of the entity checked against.
classification The classification of the entity checked against.
check A symbol / name of the check performed on the entity.
checkDescription A succinct description or intended purpose of the check.

Returns:
A List of those checks that have failed, described in Maps; an empty List if no checks were performed, or no failures occured.

getPasses

java.util.List getPasses()
Retrieve the entries for sanity checks that have passed.

Key Description
result Whether or not the check passed or failed.
name The name of the entity checked against.
classification The classification of the entity checked against.
check A symbol / name of the check performed on the entity.
checkDescription A succinct description or intended purpose of the check.

Returns:
A List of those checks that have passed, described in Maps; an empty List if no checks were performed, or no passes occured.

getResults

java.util.List getResults()
Retrieve all results of the sanity checks run.

Key Description
result Whether or not the check passed or failed.
name The name of the entity checked against.
classification The classification of the entity checked against.
check A symbol / name of the check performed on the entity.
checkDescription A succinct description or intended purpose of the check.

Returns:
A List of the results of the checks that have been run, described in Maps; an empty List if no checks were performed.

hasFailures

boolean hasFailures()
Determine if the report has instances of sanity checks that have failed.
Returns:
true if at least one sanity check has failed; false otherwise.

hasPasses

boolean hasPasses()
Determine if the report has instances of sanity checks that have passed.
Returns:
true if at least one sanity check has passed; false otherwise.

isNotNull

boolean isNotNull()
Run a sanity check to ensure the entity is not null.

Is not influenced by allowPassOnNull.

throws:
IllegalStateException An entity must be declared via a check() invokation before any sanity checks can be performed.
Returns:
true if the test passes, false otherwise.

respondsTo

boolean respondsTo(java.lang.String method)
Run a sanity check to ensure the entity responds to a method signature given.

Default behavior specified by allowPassOnNull

See groovy.lang.MetaObjectProtocol.respondsTo(Object, String)

throws:
IllegalStateException An entity must be declared via a check() invokation before any sanity checks can be performed.
throws:
IllegalArgumentException method must be provided; cannot be empty, cannot be null.
Parameters:
method - The method to test for.
Returns:
true if the test passes, false otherwise.

throws:

throws:

Parameters:

allowPassOnNull - Explicitly declare or override the behavior of allowPassOnNull
Returns:
true if the test passes, false otherwise.

runChecks

SanityChecker runChecks(groovy.lang.Closure closure)
Run the checks via Closure.

Note: The Closure resolve-strategy is owner-first, therefore it is not necessary to explicitly declare owner on variable names that collide with field names.

Parameters:
closure - The Closure containing the sanity checks to execute on.
